result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cody A Ladd

records.addlTxt: Status conference on October 19, 2022 at 10:30 am.

(Cases called at 1:31 PM - 22CF402, 22CF500, 22CF556)
Defendant Cody A Ladd in court, in custody with Attorney Karl A Schmidt.  Attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing in 22CF402 and 22CF500- waiver accepted by Court.  Information received in case 22CF556 - Defense enters pleas of Not Guilty; received by Court.  Cases referred to assigned Branch for further scheduling.

(2:25 PM cases 22CF402, 22CF500, 22CF556 called.) Prosecuting attorney Afton Brianna Lewis in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cody A Ladd in court, in custody. Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Cody A Ladd.
Parties advise are ready to proceed and will be conducting the preliminary hearing on case 22CF556.
Attorney Schmidt requests cases 22CF402, 22CF500 be scheduled for a Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary Hearing in cases 22CF402, 22CF500 is scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 1:30 pm.
Parties advise are ready to proceed and Attorney Schmidt acknowledges receipt of the Amended Complaint in 22CF556 and waives formal reading and moves to dismiss Count 2.
Court reviews the Amended Complaint in 22CF556 and finds there is sufficient information to proceed. Court denies the motion to dismiss.
State calls Officer Kevin Putzy of the Eau Claire Police Department, who is sworn and testifies.
State requests the Court take judicial notice of the bond in Eau Claire County case 22CF500. Attorney Schmidt has no objection. Court takes judicial notice of the bond in 22CF500.
State conducts direct of Officer Putzy.
Attorney Schmidt conducts cross-examination of Officer Putzy. Witness excused.
Attorney Schmidt reserves argument. State moves for bind over.
Court finds probable cause and binds the case over.
Attorney Schmidt requests an Arraignment in 22CF556 be held on July 5, 2022 at 1:30 pm while other cases appear for Preliminary Hearing.

(Cases 22CF500, 22CF402 are called at 11:19 AM- by Zoom) Defendant Cody Ladd appears in custody via video conference from the Jail with Attorney Zebulon Patek. ADA Trenton Piltz appears in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Warrants executed. Defendant updates his address. Court orders bond continues. 
Hearing: 06/29/2022 at 9:30 AM.

(9:47 AM cases 22CF402, 22CF500 called.) Prosecuting attorney Monica A Fallon in court for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Cody A Ladd does not appear in court or via Zoom. Attorney Karl A Schmidt in court for Cody A Ladd. 
Attorney Schmidt has no information for the defendant's non-appearance.
State requests warrants. Court orders warrants.
